category: Herbs that Transform Phlegm and Stop Coughing

action.primary: Draws out toxicity, discharges pus, invigorates the Blood and reduces swelling

indications: Early-stages of swollen sores to encourage suppuration or to induce those already formed to burst

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with open sores.
interactions: Do not take this herb concurrently with any pharmaceuticals as there may be a decrease in absorption and blood concentration of the drug.

useCases: Initial stages of abscesses and boils.
Un-ulcerated abscesses or those with difficulty discharging pus.
Acute mastitis - take 30 g of powder in a ratio of 1:10 Zao Jiao Ci to Ge Qiao followed warm grain-based liquor.

notes: This herb should be boiled into a thick paste to be applied topically. for sores and dermatosis.
This herb draws out toxins and expels Wind-Heat and Wind-toxins from the Blood to treat leprosy.
This herb may be used individually for tonsillitis.
This herb is similar to Fr. Gleditsiae #{ZaoJiao} Zao Jiao but is sharper and more directly penetrates to the site of the illness.
It has the ability to ascend and treat disorders of the upper Jiao such as tonsillitis.
It also treats ulcers, caked breasts, eczema, carbuncles, inflammation and fungal infections.
This herb inhibits the growth of cancer cells.
To treat mammary abscess grind 30g of slightly charred Zao Jiao Ci with 3g Anodonta Pulveratum (mussel) to a powder and take 3 g at a time with warm wine.

For serious diseases caused by Wind, falling of the eyebrows and collapse of the nose, char and decoct 1500g Zao Jiao Ci with 3g Rx. et Rz. Rhei #{DaHuang} Da Huang for oral administration after meals.
